title: TC001-Welcome Page Loads Successfully
description: Verify that the welcome page loads correctly with navigation options to education levels.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Education Level Selection').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The welcome page did not load correctly or navigation options to education levels are missing as per the test plan.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
Failed to go to the start URL. Err: Error executing action go_to_url: Page.goto: net::ERR_EMPTY_RESPONSE at http://localhost:5173/
Call log:
  - navigating to "http://localhost:5173/", waiting until "load"

title: TC002-Education Level Selection Displays Correctly
description: Verify education levels are displayed without numeric icons and user can select a level.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Education Level 1').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: Education levels should be displayed without numeric icons, but a numeric icon was found in the education level listing.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

description: Verify filieres are listed in pages showing exactly 5 items per page with functional pagination controls.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Pagination Controls Not Found').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The filieres listing page does not display pagination controls as expected, preventing verification of 5 items per page and navigation between pages.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:

from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well

            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        try:
            await expect(page.locator('text=No JavaScript errors detected').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test failed: The React error boundary did not catch the JavaScript error and display the fallback UI as expected.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

description: Verify that the Axios client interceptors modify requests as expected, and handle response errors correctly.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Successful API Request').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Axios client interceptors did not modify requests or handle response errors as expected. The expected success message 'Successful API Request' was not found, indicating failure in request modification or error handling.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        try:
            await expect(page.locator('text=Full Page Reload Detected').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test failed: Navigation using React Router caused a full page reload or state persistence did not behave correctly as per the test plan.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        try:
            await expect(page.locator('text=Pagination component loaded successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test failed: The pagination component did not display page numbers or navigation controls correctly, or did not trigger page changes on user interaction as expected.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

async def run_test():
    pw = None

        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode

            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well

from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
